emuInput.TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women and men standing in grocery store, from left: Harry Seitz, Jacqueline Pettigrew, Virgie Saunders, Corelia Lawson, Mildred Jeffreys, Arlene Gilmore, and Gentle Horne, posed in Thorofare Market, Centre Avenue
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. A4, reads: "The Thorofare Staff - Harry Seitz, manager of the Centre Avenue Thorofare Market, poses with six of his cashier-checkers who were candidates in recent contest to determine the best cashier-checker of the year. From the left of Mr. Seitz are Jacqueline Pettigrew, Virgie Saunders, Corelia Lawson, assistant manager; Mildred Jeffreys, Arlene Gilmore and Gentle Horne, stockman, also a cashier-checker.  Mrs. Lawson is the only woman assistant manager in the Thorofare chain, which operated in Pennsylvinia [sic], West Virginia and parts of Ohio. - Harris Photo."
